pr_title: Better messaging on broker redirect uri mismatch.

timeline.message: Better messaging on redirect uri mismatch.

timeline.bodyText:
Optionally return the entire expression?
return matcher.matches() && ObjectUtils.equals(mAppContext.getPackageName(), matcher.group(1));
timeline.author: iambmelt

timeline.message: Take code review comments, add a unit test.
Ass assertions to tests, correct regular expression.

timeline.bodyText: See that this was an info message previously.  We may want to warn here instead.
timeline.author: shoatman

timeline.bodyText:
Agreed.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        Logger.info(TAG, "The app is still using legacy MSAL redirect uri. Switch to MSAL local auth."
          
          
            
                        Logger.warn(TAG, "The app is still using legacy MSAL redirect uri. Switch to MSAL local auth."
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.bodyText: Is this meant to be used outside of the context of an Android app? Because this regex seems to accept invalid android application package names
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Not really - it's private. But the idea is that this pulls out the authority segment of a URI with the correct scheme, and then we compare that string with equals on the package name. But there's only one usage of it...
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText:
Okay, I think it is fine as this only being used in this class....but just wanted to point out that the group 1 which is supposed to match the package name, seems to accept anything but a slash, so I think this would accept redirect uri that are formed via package names that aren't actually valid Android application ids....but I think since this is all internal it is probably okay. However, it may still be good to make it more specific.
FYI, Application id aka "Android app package name" naming conventions are listed here: https://developer.android.com/studio/build/application-id
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I realize what it was doing... but my mind was in the regex prison, and we don't need to use a Pattern at all, not just a dynamic one.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.message: Change away from needless regular expression.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        Logger.warn(TAG, "The app is still using legacy MSAL redirect uri. Switch to MSAL local auth."
          
          
            
                            + "  For brokered auth, the redirect URI is expected to conform to 'msauth://<authority>/.*' where the authority in "
          
          
            
                            + "that uri is the package name.");
          
          
            
                        Logger.warn(TAG, "The app is still using legacy MSAL redirect uri. Switch to MSAL local auth."
          
          
            
                            + "  For brokered auth, the redirect URI is expected to conform to 'msauth://<authority>/.*' where the authority in "
          
          
            
                            + "that uri is the package name of the app. This package name is listed as 'applicationId' in the build.gradle file.");
timeline.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: Does the package name have to be nullable?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: There's no requirement for the restriction to NonNull.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: So what should be return from this method if package name is null? I don't see a null check here
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: It doesn't matter, so I'm making it @nonnull
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx
